subject: Question about the old Simpson pedals wiring?
description_text:
Hello Simpsonn employee! I recently been having wire disconnecting
problems, and was wondering if there’s anywhere I can buy replacement wires
for the throttle?
It seems that whenever the angle of the wire coming out of the box is too
sharp it will put in a signal at 100% throttle pressure.
Is there anything I can do? I’ve been using these original pedals for years
and they amazing!!
Thank you so much for the awesome pedals so far!

conversations.body_text: Hi Mr. Simple,     You can go to a local computer repair shop and have them re-crimp a RJ11 4P4C connector. Please follow the throttle wiring order, cut the cable at the position indicated by the arrow, and make a new connector. This should quickly resolve the issue.

Awesome, thank you so much!

On Fri, Jan 9, 2026 at 9:43 PM service@simsonn.com

I found that the black wire could be reconnected as a temporary fix, but
what is that 5th wire?

On Fri, Jan 9, 2026 at 9:43 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Mr. Simple,      The yellow wire is the ground wire. It doesn’t need to be connected separately at the moment; you can also tie it together with the black wire.

This is my funny temporary fix with some pliers instead of electrical tape
lol.
Not sure how there was almost a centimeter of missing black wire, Looked
may be burnt from a short.
But it’s working now lol
On Tue, Jan 13, 2026 at 2:02 AM service@simsonn.com

Forgot to attach the picture of the fix

On Tue, Jan 13, 2026 at 2:02 AM service@simsonn.com

Hi Mr. Simple,  This is the solder joint where we previously soldered the yellow wire to the black wire. It may have come loose due to pulling or tension. Please re-solder this connection — using pliers is only a temporary workaround and may still cause an unstable connection over time.
